title: 112_hr6104
content: The "Working Families Tax Protection Act of 2012" is cited as the short title. It extends the 2001 tax relief for the middle class. The "Working Families Tax Protection Act of 2012" extends the 2001 tax relief provisions, including individual income tax rate reductions, tax benefits for children, marriage penalty relief, and affordable education provisions, until December 31, 2013. The "Working Families Tax Protection Act of 2012" extends individual income tax rate reductions, including adjustments to the 25%, 28%, and 33% brackets, with a new 35% bracket for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012. The tax rate for a taxpayer's income in the highest bracket will be 35% if it does not exceed a certain threshold, with a 39.6% rate applying to income exceeding that threshold. The tax code includes an overall limitation on itemized deductions and a phaseout of personal exemptions. The applicable threshold for the limitation is $500,000 for subsection (a) and half of that amount for subsections (b), (c), and (d). The highest rate bracket is defined as the 39.6-percent bracket. Section 68 of the tax code is amended to change the applicable amount to the applicable threshold. Subsection (b) is removed, and subsections (c), (d), and (e) are redesignated. Subsections (f) and (g) are also removed. Additionally, there is a phaseout of deductions for personal exemptions. Section 68 of the tax code is amended to change the threshold amount to the applicable threshold. Subsection (b) is removed, and subsections (c), (d), and (e) are redesignated. Subsections (f) and (g) are also removed. The tax code is amended to adjust for inflation in taxable years beginning after 1989. Application of sunsets is specified for individual income tax rates. The Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 applies to the amendments made in this section, including the phaseout of personal exemptions and itemized deductions. These amendments are effective for taxable years starting after December 31, 2012. Extension of 2003 tax relief for the middle class. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is amended to extend the deadline to December 31, 2013. Certain provisions regarding high-income individuals are also modified in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is amended to extend the deadline to December 31, 2013. Provisions for high-income individuals in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are also adjusted, including changes to taxable income rates and capital gains taxes. The Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is amended to extend the deadline to December 31, 2013. Amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 include adjustments to taxable income rates and capital gains taxes for high-income individuals. The new provisions specify the application of the maximum rate of tax on net capital gain for noncorporate taxpayers. The amendment increases the maximum rate of tax on net capital gain for noncorporate taxpayers to 20 percent, replacing the previous rate of 15 percent. This change applies to high-income individuals and includes adjustments to taxable income rates under the Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003. The amendment increases the maximum rate of tax on net capital gain for noncorporate taxpayers to 20 percent, replacing the previous rate of 15 percent. Sections of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 are amended accordingly. The application of sunset provision from the Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 is also specified. The amendments made by this section of the Act apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2012, with specific withholding amendments effective for amounts paid on or after January 1, 2013. SEC. 4. EXTENSION OF 2009 TAX RELIEF. The text chunk discusses amendments to tax credits for the years 2012 and 2013, including the American Opportunity Tax Credit, Child Tax Credit, and Earned Income Tax Credit. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.
